intro: Epacris campanulata var. maxima, commonly known as the large bell heath, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in forested areas and is often found in regions with high rainfall. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and flowering plants adapted to nutrient-poor soils. The variety maxima is distinguished by its larger flower size compared to other varieties of Epacris campanulata.
